posts.author: TyrTemplar
posts.content:
What can I say, other than you have just gotta LOVE a Gnome that can basically carry all the King's Horses along with all the King's men across country, on his back! Seeing all that brash hack 'n slash power especially on a Gnome (along with all the skills on a Barbarian), heh, just brings a tear to my eyes.

Love what you've done here. GOOD JOB. And yes, Thunder does deserve a story, I agree! Thinking something along the lines of, "Don't make me angry. You wouldn't like me when I'm angry." A Thundering (day) in Paradise, indeed!!

Rage ON! ~ Tyr

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Have to love this little "Thor" with his thundering hammer.
It is a good and solid build!

Did you factor in +1 for small stature when calculating AB and AC?

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
FYI: There is a 20% experience penalty from level 21 to the end for this build.
Mick Dagger wrote:
Did you factor in +1 for small stature when calculating AB and AC?


 
30bab + 11str + 1wf + 2ewf + 1small = 45, so at least for AB he did (note no prowess this build).  I'm too lazy to calc the AC but must assume the same is true for that rating as well (22 vs. perhaps 23 is fairly insignificant i.e. this toon will be getting hit a lot either way so pray to the god of EDR).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
As far as I can figure it, he loses 2 AC for not having Armor Skin and another 2 for having only 8 DEX, but gains those 4 back from RDD,and he gets the full 8 from Tumble. With +1 from small stature, I think his AC in mundane plate and shield is 33, which is not too bad. Also, he can get another 1 or 2 AC from a Cat's Grace pot. Oh wait.: For a Gnome, a warhammer is a 2-handed weapon, so no shield, so -3 AC for that (and any lost magic AC), resulting in an AC of 30.
His damage reduction is 15/- (6/- from Barbarian 28 and 9/- from EDR III).
If I were to play this, I'd happily trade Thundering Rage for either Epic Prowess or Armor Skin.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Guess small did figure then (10 + 8tum + 4rdd +1small - 1dex = 22).  I completely forgot about the 2-handed business for small race myself so kudos for reminding us, Empyre.

As for dumping Thundering Rage, I quite agree.  I had been considering a thematic druid/barb rage build many moons ago and had slotted Thundering when Max pointed out that so many weapons had the Massive Criticals property on them that the hypothetical bonus was seldom realized.  However, in my case I was trying to optimize the Dire Brown Bear shape which uses only creature weapon attack so, in that atypical case, the feat had more merit than with standard weaponry.  All-in-all though, Thundering Rage should only be a candidate after key essentials have been addressed.
